Answer is yes but could you post any Cactus related message on the cactus-u=
ser mailing list please ? (see http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/mailinglist=
.html).
Thanks
-Vincent

----- Original Message ----- 
  From: gopala krish=
nan T 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, September 25, 2001 11:=
23 AM
  Subject: [junit] does cactus support ejb2.0 and weblogic6.0


  we =
are using EJB 2.0 on Weblogic(6.0).Does cactus works on th above details.as=
 u ahev given that it is tested on weblogicv(5.1) 
    ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
    From: vmassol@... 
    To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
    Se=
nt: Tuesday, September 25, 2001 4:16 PM
    Subject: [junit] [announce] Cac=
tus v1.2 is released


    The Jakarta Cactus project (http://jakarta.apach=
e.org/cactus) is 
    proud to announce the release of version 1.2. Cactus =
is a unit 
    testing framework for testing server side java code. It supp=
orts unit 
    testing of : 

    * Servlets, 
    * JSP Tag libraries, 
  =
  * Servlet Filters, 
    * EJBs, 
    * JSPs 

    Please check the Featur=
es list 
    (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/features.html) and the Chang=
elog 
    (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/changes.html#release_changes) f=
or 
    details on what's new.

    Cactus also provides several Jakarta An=
t scripts to automate unit 
    testing on your server and has been tested =
on the following servers : 
    Tomcat (v3.2, v3.3, v4.0), Resin (v1.2, v1.=
3, v2.0), Orion (1.4, 1.5) 
    and WebLogic (v5.1). It works with all Serv=
let 2.2 and 2.3 compliant 
    servlet engines.

    In addition, Cactus 1 =
adds tight integration with HttpUnit for easy 
    asserting of server resp=
onses.

    Thank you
    -The Cactus Team



    To unsubscribe from this =
group, send an email to:
    junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com


    Your u=
se of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service. 


        Y=
ahoo! Groups Sponsor 
              ADVERTISEMENT

scribe@yahoogroups.com

o! Terms of Service.
